framework.name: Sample Mathematics Standards
framework.description: Sample mathematics curriculum standards for demonstration purposes

standards.subcategory: Applying and extending previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions
standards.description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.

standards.subcategory: Applying and extending previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions
standards.description: Write, read, and evaluate expressions in which letters stand for numbers.

standards.subcategory: Solve real-life and mathematical problems using numerical and algebraic expressions and equations
standards.description: Apply properties of operations to add and subtract linear expressions.

standards.subcategory: Work with radicals and integer exponents
standards.description: Know and apply the properties of integer exponents.

standards.subcategory: Understand solving equations as a process of reasoning and explain the reasoning
standards.description: Explain each step in solving a simple equation as following from the equality of numbers asserted at the previous step, starting from the assumption that the original equation has a solution.

standards.subcategory: Represent and solve equations and inequalities graphically
standards.description: Understand that the graph of an equation in two variables is the set of all its solutions plotted in the coordinate plane, often forming a curve.

standards.subcategory: Understand the concept of a function and use function notation
standards.description: Understand that a function from one set (called the domain) to another set (called the range) assigns to each element of the domain exactly one element of the range.
Graph functions expressed symbolically and show key features of the graph.

standards.subcategory: Build a function that models a relationship between two quantities
standards.description: Write a function that describes a relationship between two quantities.

standards.subcategory: Extend the domain of trigonometric functions using the unit circle
standards.description: Understand radian measure of an angle as the length of the arc on the unit circle subtended by the angle.
